fields.doc: x.__enter__() -> self -- begin this slow task
fields.name: __enter__

fields.doc: x.__exit__(type, value, traceback) -> None -- end this slow task
fields.name: __exit__

fields.doc: Initialize self.  See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.
fields.name: ___init__

fields.doc: Initialize self.  See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.
fields.name: new

fields.doc: x.enter_progress_frame(work=1.0, desc=Text()) -> None -- indicate that we are to enter a frame that will take up the specified amount of work (completes any previous frames)
fields.name: enter_progress_frame

fields.doc: x.make_dialog(can_cancel=False, allow_in_pie=False) -> None -- creates a new dialog for this slow task, if there is currently not one open
fields.name: make_dialog

fields.doc: x.make_dialog_delayed(delay, can_cancel=False, allow_in_pie=False) -> None -- creates a new dialog for this slow task after the given time threshold. If the task completes before this time, no dialog will be shown
fields.name: make_dialog_delayed

fields.doc: x.should_cancel() -> bool -- True if the user has requested that the slow task be canceled
fields.name: should_cancel
